about.title: Who I am
about.story: Born in Albuquerque, New Mexico, raised in Boise, Idaho, and now based in Madison, Wisconsin. I'm a Computer Science and Data Science student at UW Madison with dual Swedish-American citizenship. I'm passionate about building production-ready ML systems and data products that solve real-world problems.
about.approach: My work focuses on the intersection of data science and software engineering. I specialize in real-time ETL pipelines, model training/serving, and interactive dashboards. I'm drawn to projects that combine technical complexity with practical applications.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: End-to-end ML systems and data products built with production-ready architecture

featured.title: Madison Metro Bus ETA
featured.subtitle: End-to-end ML system
featured.description: Built real-time ETA prediction pipeline using GTFS-RT data, feature store (Postgres), and sequence models (LSTM/Transformer). Deployed models via FastAPI with caching; containerized services and automated CI (GitHub Actions). Designed interactive Leaflet dashboard for live route predictions and error diagnostics.

featured.title: 3D Satellite Visualization
featured.subtitle: Advanced spatial visualization
featured.description: Developed advanced 3D globe visualization rendering real-time satellite tracking data using math-intensive spatial algorithms. Replicated and enhanced N2YO website functionality in full 3D environment, providing immersive satellite visualization with smooth real-time rendering.

featured.title: Brain2Text 2025
featured.subtitle: Neural decoding research team
featured.description: Part of research team tackling Brain2Text Kaggle competition—building models that decode raw brain signals from ALS patients into readable text. Handled data wrangling (256-channel neural recordings, 11GB files), environment engineering, and baseline reproduction using bidirectional GRUs with CTC loss on RTX 4090 setup.
